SENT.plain: Patients with a clinical picture of acute ischemic stroke are a heterogeneous group
The aim of this study was to evaluate the added utility of CT perfusion (CTP) and CT angiography (CTA) in the workup of three different categories of acute ischemic stroke patients
Fifty patients (61+/-15 years old) were included in this retrospective analysis
Twenty-nine patients had transient ischemic attacks (TIAs) (Group I), 15 were not eligible for treatment with thrombolysis (Group II) and six showed no improvement after thrombolysis (Group III)
CTP and CTA provided additional information, not revealed by plain CT, in all the Group II patients and in one third of the patients belonging to the other groups
The final diagnoses were TIA (n=23), thromboembolic cerebral infarctions (n=22), carotid artery dissection (n=4) and metastases (n=1)
Of the 29 patients admitted with TIA, only 22 patients still had this diagnosis on discharge from the stroke unit
Given the risk of impending stroke, it would be important to include these modalities in the initial workup of TIA
